page.title: 16Dovercourt's Rector's Day:am
page.content: {The Rector of Dovercourt's day typically begins when he gets up at 7am and has breakfast. He then spends about half an hour at his desk, dealing with the morning post and any phone messages. At 8.30am he and the other clergy team members are in church to say the daily office. At 9.10am he is at the local Church of England School (All Saints) for their Assembly. Next comes the service of Eucharist at 10am in the church. The Rector then takes the Sacrament to the housebound and sick. At about 11.30 a.m he returns home to study and continue working on sermons and Bible study outlines for the weeks ahead. This takes until lunchtime.
